13.text: If thou turn away thy foot from the sabbath,fromdoing thy pleasure on my holy day; and call thesabbatha delight, the holy of theLord, honourable; and shalt honour him, not doing thine own ways, nor finding thine own pleasure, nor speakingthine ownwords:

14.text: Then shalt thou delight thyself in theLord; and I will cause thee to ride upon thehigh placesof the earth, and feed thee with the heritage of Jacob thy father: for the mouth of theLordhath spokenit.

1.text: Behold, theLordshandis notshortened, that it cannot save; neither his ear heavy, that it cannothear:

2.text: But your iniquities haveseparatedbetween you and your God, and yoursinshave hidhisface from you, that he will nothear.

3.text: For your hands are defiled withblood, and your fingers with iniquity; your lips have spoken lies, your tongue hath muttered perverseness.

4.text: None calleth for justice, noranypleadeth for truth: theytrustin vanity, and speak lies; they conceivemischief, and bring forth iniquity.

5.text: They hatch cockatrice eggs, and weave the spiders web: he that eateth of their eggs dieth, and that which is crushed breaketh out into viper.

6.text: Their webs shall not become garments, neither shall they cover themselves with their works: their worksareworks of iniquity, and the act of violenceisin their hands.

7.text: Their feetruntoevil, and they makehastetoshedinnocent blood: their thoughtsarethoughts of iniquity; wasting and destructionarein their paths.

8.text: The way ofpeacethey know not; andthere isnojudgmentin their goings: they have made themcrookedpaths: whosoever goeth therein shall not know peace.

9.text: Therefore is judgment far from us, neither dothjusticeovertake us: we wait forlight, but behold obscurity; for brightness,butwewalkin darkness.

10.text: Wegropefor the wall like the blind, and we grope as ifwe hadno eyes: we stumble at noonday as in the night;we arein desolate places as deadmen.

11.text: We roar all like bears, and mourn sore like doves: we look for judgment, butthere isnone; for salvation,butit is far off from us.

12.text: For our transgressions are multiplied before thee, and our sinstestifyagainst us: for our transgressionsarewith us; andas forour iniquities, weknowthem;

13.text: In transgressing and lying against theLord, and departing away from our God, speaking oppression and revolt, conceiving and uttering from the heart words of falsehood.

14.text: And judgment is turned away backward, and justice standeth afar off: for truth is fallen in the street, andequitycannot enter.

15.text: Yea, truth faileth; and hethatdeparteth from evil maketh himself prey: and theLordsawit,and it displeased him thatthere wasno judgment.

16.text: And he saw thatthere wasno man, and wondered thatthere wasnointercessor: therefore hisarmbroughtsalvationunto him; and his righteousness, it sustained him.

17.text: For he put onrighteousnessas abreastplate, and an helmet of salvation upon his head; and he put on the garments of vengeanceforclothing, and was clad with zeal as cloak.

18.text: According totheirdeeds, accordingly he willrepay, fury to his adversaries,recompenceto his enemies; to the islands he will repay recompence.

19.text: So shall theyfearthenameof theLordfrom the west, and his glory from the rising of the sun. When the enemy shall come in like flood, theSpiritof theLordshall lift up standard against him.

20.text: And theRedeemershallcometoZion, and unto them thatturnfrom transgression in Jacob, saith theLord.

21.text: As for me, thisismycovenantwith them, saith theLord; My spirit thatisupon thee, and my words which I have put in thy mouth, shall not depart out of thy mouth, nor out of the mouth of thy seed, nor out of the mouth of thy seeds seed, saith theLord, from henceforth and for ever.

1.text: Arise, shine; for thylightis come, and the glory of theLordis risen upon thee.

2.text: For, behold, thedarknessshall cover the earth, and grossdarknessthe people: but theLordshallarise upon thee, and hisgloryshall be seen upon thee.

3.text: And theGentilesshall come to thylight, and kings to the brightness of thy rising.

4.text: Lift up thine eyes round about, and see: all they gather themselves together, they come to thee: thysonsshall come from far, and thy daughters shall be nursed atthyside.

5.text: Then thou shalt see, andflow together, and thine heart shall fear, and be enlarged; because theabundanceof the sea shall be converted unto thee, theforcesof theGentilesshall come unto thee.

6.text: The multitude of camels shall cover thee, the dromedaries of Midian and Ephah; all they from Sheba shall come: they shall bringgoldand incense; and they shall shew forth the praises of theLord.

7.text: All the flocks ofKedarshall be gathered together unto thee, the rams of Nebaioth shall minister unto thee: they shall come up withacceptanceon minealtar, and I will glorify the house of myglory.

8.text: Whoarethesethatfly as cloud, and as the doves to their windows?

9.text: Surely theislesshall wait forme, and the ships of Tarshish first, tobringthy sons from far, their silver and their gold with them, unto the name of theLordthy God, and to the Holy One of Israel, because he hath glorified thee.

10.text: And thesonsof strangers shallbuildup thy walls, and their kings shall minister unto thee: for in mywrathI smote thee, but in my favour have I had mercy on thee.

11.text: Therefore thygatesshall be open continually; they shall not be shut day nor night; thatmenmay bring unto thee theforces of the Gentiles, andthattheir kingsmay bebrought.

12.text: For thenationandkingdomthat will not serve thee shallperish; yea,thosenationsshall be utterly wasted.

13.text: The glory ofLebanonshall come unto thee, thefirtree, the pine tree, and the box together, tobeautifythe place of my sanctuary; and I will make the place of myfeetglorious.

14.text: The sons also of them that afflicted thee shall come bending unto thee; and all they that despised thee shallbowthemselves down at the soles of thy feet; and they shall call thee, The city of theLord, The Zion of the Holy One of Israel.

15.text: Whereas thou hast beenforsakenand hated, so that no man went throughthee,I will make thee an eternal excellency, joy of many generations.

16.text: Thou shalt also suck themilkof the Gentiles, and shalt suck the breast ofkings: and thou shalt know that I theLordamthySaviourand thy Redeemer, the mighty One of Jacob.

17.text: For brass I will bring gold, and for iron I will bring silver, and for wood brass, and for stones iron: I will also make thy officers peace, and thine exactors righteousness.

18.text: Violenceshall no more be heard in thy land, wasting nor destruction within thy borders; but thou shalt call thywallsSalvation, and thy gatesPraise.

19.text: Thesunshall be no more thy light by day; neither for brightness shall the moon give light unto thee: but theLordshall be unto thee an everlastinglight, and thy God thy glory.

20.text: Thy sun shall no more go down; neither shall thy moon withdraw itself: for theLordshall be thineeverlastinglight, and the days of thymourningshall be ended.

21.text: Thy people alsoshall beallrighteous: they shall inherit thelandforever, thebranchof my planting, theworkof my hands, that I may be glorified.

22.text: Alittle oneshall become thousand, and small one astrongnation: I theLordwill hasten it inhistime.

1.text: TheSpiritof the LordGodisupon me; because theLordhathanointedme topreachgood tidingsunto themeek; he hath sent me tobindup the brokenhearted, toproclaimlibertyto thecaptives, and the opening of theprisontothem that arebound;

2.text: To proclaim the acceptable year of theLord, and the day ofvengeanceof our God; tocomfortall thatmourn;

3.text: To appoint unto them that mourn in Zion, to give unto thembeautyfor ashes, the oil ofjoyfor mourning, the garment of praise for the spirit of heaviness; that they might be calledtreesofrighteousness, theplantingof theLord, that he might be glorified.

4.text: And they shallbuildthe old wastes, they shall raise up the former desolations, and they shall repair the waste cities, the desolations of many generations.

5.text: And strangers shall stand and feed your flocks, and the sons of the alienshall beyour plowmen and your vinedressers.

6.text: But ye shall be named thePriestsof theLord:menshall call you the Ministers of our God: ye shall eat therichesof the Gentiles, and in their glory shall ye boast yourselves.

7.text: For your shameye shall havedouble; andforconfusion they shall rejoice in their portion: therefore in their land they shall possessthe double: everlasting joy shall be unto them.

8.text: For I theLordlovejudgment, I hate robbery for burnt offering; and I will direct their work in truth, and I will make an everlastingcovenantwith them.

9.text: And their seed shall be known among the Gentiles, and their offspring among the people: all that see them shall acknowledge them, that theyaretheseedwhichtheLordhath blessed.

10.text: I will greatly rejoice in theLord, my soul shall be joyful in my God; for he hathclothedme with thegarmentsof salvation, he hath covered me with the robe of righteousness, as bridegroom deckethhimselfwith ornaments, and as bride adornethherselfwith her jewels.

11.text: For as the earth bringeth forth her bud, and as the garden causeth the things that are sown in it to spring forth; so the LordGodwill cause righteousness andpraiseto spring forth before all the nations.

1.text: For Zions sake will I not hold my peace, and for Jerusalems sake I will not rest, until the righteousness thereof go forth as brightness, andthe salvation thereof as lampthatburneth.

2.text: And the Gentiles shallseethy righteousness, and all kings thy glory: and thou shalt be called by newname, which the mouth of theLordshall name.

3.text: Thou shalt also be acrownof glory in the hand of theLord, and royal diadem in the hand of thy God.

4.text: Thou shalt no more be termedForsaken; neither shall thylandany more be termed Desolate: but thou shalt be calledHephzi-bah, and thy landBeulah: for theLorddelighteth in thee, and thy land shall be married.

5.text: Forasa young man marrieth virgin,soshall thy sons marry thee: andasthe bridegroom rejoiceth over the bride,soshall thy Godrejoiceover thee.

6.text: I have setwatchmenupon thy walls, O Jerusalem,whichshall never hold their peace day nor night: ye that make mention of theLord, keep not silence,

7.text: And give him no rest, till he establish, and till he make Jerusalem apraisein the earth.

8.text: TheLordhath sworn by his right hand, and by the arm of his strength, Surely I will no more give thy cornto bemeat for thine enemies; and the sons of the stranger shall not drink thy wine, for the which thou hast laboured:

9.text: But they that have gathered it shall eat it, and praise theLord; and they that have brought it together shall drink it in the courts of myholiness.

10.text: Go through, go through the gates;prepareye the way of the people; cast up, cast up thehighway; gather out the stones; lift up astandardfor the people.

11.text: Behold, theLordhath proclaimed unto the end of theworld, Say ye to thedaughterof Zion, Behold, thysalvationcometh; behold, hisrewardiswith him, and his work before him.

12.text: And they shall call them, The holy people, The redeemed of theLord: and thou shalt be called, Sought out, A city not forsaken.

1.text: Whoisthis thatcomethfromEdom, with dyed garments from Bozrah? thisthat isglorious in his apparel, travelling in the greatness of his strength? I that speak in righteousness, mighty to save.

2.text: Whereforeart thouredin thine apparel, and thy garments like him that treadeth in thewinefat?

3.text: I have trodden thewinepressalone; and of the peoplethere wasnone with me: for I will tread them in mine anger, and trample them in my fury; and their blood shall besprinkledupon my garments, and I will stain all my raiment.

4.text: For the day ofvengeanceisin mine heart, and the year of myredeemedis come.

5.text: And I looked, andthere wasnone to help; and I wondered thatthere wasnone to uphold: therefore mine own arm broughtsalvationunto me; and my fury, it upheld me.

6.text: And I will tread down the people in mine anger, andmake them drunkin my fury, and I will bring down their strength to the earth.

7.text: I will mention thelovingkindnessesof theLord,andthe praises of theLord, according to all that theLordhath bestowed on us, and the greatgoodnesstoward the house of Israel, which he hath bestowed on them according to his mercies, and according to the multitude of his lovingkindnesses.

8.text: For he said, Surely theyaremy people, childrenthatwill not lie: so he was theirSaviour.

9.text: In all theirafflictionhe was afflicted, and theangelof hispresencesaved them: in hisloveand in his pity heredeemedthem; and he bare them, andcarriedthem all the days of old.

10.text: But theyrebelled, andvexedhisholy Spirit: therefore he was turned to be theirenemy,andhe fought against them.

11.text: Thenhe rememberedthe days of old, Moses,andhis people,saying,Whereishe that brought them up out of theseawith theshepherdof hisflock? whereishe that put his holy Spirit withinhim?

12.text: That ledthemby the right hand ofMoseswith his glorious arm,dividingthe water before them, to make himself an everlasting name?

13.text: That led them through the deep, as an horse in the wilderness,thatthey should not stumble?

14.text: As beast goethdown into the valley, theSpiritof theLordcausedhimto rest: so didst thou lead thy people, to make thyself gloriousname.

15.text: Lookdown from heaven, and behold from the habitation of thyholinessand of thy glory: whereisthy zeal and thy strength,thesounding of thy bowels and of thy mercies toward me? are they restrained?

16.text: Doubtless thouartourfather, though Abrahambe ignorantof us, and Israel acknowledge us not: thou, OLord,artour father, our redeemer; thy nameisfromeverlasting.

17.text: OLord, why hast thoumadeus to err from thy ways,andhardenedour heart from thy fear? Return for thy servants sake, the tribes of thine inheritance.

18.text: Thepeopleof thy holiness have possesseditbut little while: our adversaries havetroddendown thy sanctuary.

19.text: We arethine:thou never barest rule over them; they were not called by thyname.

1.text: Oh that thou wouldestrendthe heavens, that thou wouldest come down, that themountainsmight flow down at thypresence,

2.text: Aswhenthe melting fire burneth, the fire causeth the waters to boil, to make thy name known to thine adversaries,thatthe nations maytrembleat thy presence!

3.text: When thou didstterriblethingswhichwe looked not for, thou camest down, themountainsflowed down at thy presence.

4.text: For since the beginning of the worldmenhave not heard, nor perceived by the ear, neither hath theeyeseen, O God, beside thee,whathe hathpreparedfor him that waiteth for him.

5.text: Thou meetest him that rejoiceth and worketh righteousness,those thatremember thee in thy ways: behold, thou art wroth; for we have sinned: in those is continuance, and we shall be saved.

6.text: But we are all as anuncleanthing,and all our righteousnessesareasfilthyrags; and we all do fade as leaf; and our iniquities, like the wind, have taken us away.

7.text: Andthere isnone that calleth upon thy name, that stirreth up himself to take hold of thee: for thou hast hid thyfacefrom us, and hast consumed us, because of our iniquities.

8.text: But now, OLord, thouartourfather; wearethe clay, and thou our potter; and we allaretheworkof thy hand.

9.text: Be not wroth very sore, OLord, neither remember iniquity for ever: behold, see, we beseech thee, weareall thypeople.

10.text: Thy holy cities are wilderness, Zion is wilderness, Jerusalem desolation.

11.text: Our holy and ourbeautifulhouse, where our fathers praised thee, isburnedup with fire: and all our pleasant things are laidwaste.

12.text: Wilt thourefrainthyself for thesethings,OLord? wilt thou hold thy peace, and afflict us very sore?

1.text: I amsoughtofthem thatasked notfor me;I am found ofthem thatsought me not: I said, Behold me, behold me, unto nationthatwas not called by myname.

2.text: I have spread out my hands all the day unto arebelliouspeople, which walketh in waythat wasnot good, after their own thoughts;

3.text: A people that provoketh me toangercontinually to my face; that sacrificeth in gardens, and burneth incense upon altars ofbrick;

4.text: Which remainamong the graves, and lodge in the monuments, which eat swines flesh, and broth of abominablethings is intheir vessels;

5.text: Which say, Stand by thyself, come not near to me; for I amholierthan thou. Thesearea smoke in my nose, fire that burneth all the day.

6.text: Behold,it iswritten before me: I will not keep silence, but willrecompense, even recompense into their bosom,

7.text: Your iniquities, and the iniquities of your fathers together, saith theLord, which have burned incense upon the mountains, andblasphemedme upon the hills: therefore will I measure their former work into their bosom.

8.text: Thus saith theLord, As thenew wineis found in the cluster, andonesaith, Destroy it not; for blessingisin it: so will I do for my servants sakes, that I maynotdestroy them all.

9.text: And I will bring forth seed out of Jacob, and out ofJudahan inheritor of my mountains: and mineelectshallinheritit, and my servants shall dwell there.

10.text: And Sharon shall be fold of flocks, and the valley ofAchora place for the herds to lie down in, for my people that have sought me.

11.text: But yearethey that forsake theLord, that forget my holy mountain, that prepare table for thattroop, and that furnish the drink offering unto thatnumber.

12.text: Therefore will I number you to the sword, and ye shall all bow down to the slaughter: because when Icalled, ye did not answer; when I spake, ye did not hear; but did evil before mine eyes, and did choosethatwherein I delighted not.

13.text: Therefore thus saith the LordGod, Behold, my servants shall eat, but ye shall be hungry: behold, my servants shall drink, but ye shall be thirsty: behold, my servants shall rejoice, but ye shall be ashamed:

14.text: Behold, my servants shall sing for joy of heart, but ye shall cry for sorrow of heart, and shallhowlfor vexation of spirit.

15.text: And ye shall leave your name for acurseunto my chosen: for the LordGodshall slay thee, and call his servants by anothername:

16.text: That he whoblesseth himselfin the earth shall bless himself in the God of truth; and he that sweareth in the earth shallswearby the God of truth; because the former troubles are forgotten, and because they are hid from mine eyes.

17.text: For, behold, Icreatenewheavensand anewearth: and theformershall not be remembered, nor come into mind.

18.text: But be ye glad and rejoice for everin thatwhich I create: for, behold, I create Jerusalem arejoicing, and her people joy.

19.text: And I willrejoicein Jerusalem, and joy in my people: and the voice of weeping shall be no more heard in her, nor the voice of crying.

20.text: There shall be no more thence an infant of days, nor anoldman that hath not filled his days: for thechildshall die an hundred years old; but the sinnerbeingan hundred years old shall be accursed.

21.text: And they shall build houses, and inhabitthem;and they shall plant vineyards, andeatthe fruit of them.

22.text: They shall not build, and another inhabit; they shall not plant, and another eat: for as the days of atreearethe days of my people, and mine elect shall long enjoy the work of their hands.

23.text: They shall notlabourin vain,nor bring forth for trouble; for theyaretheseedof the blessed of theLord, and theiroffspringwith them.

24.text: And it shall come to pass, that before they call, I willanswer; and while they are yet speaking, I will hear.

25.text: Thewolfand the lamb shallfeedtogether, and the lion shall eat straw like the bullock: and dustshall bethe serpents meat. They shall nothurtnor destroy in all my holy mountain, saith theLord.

1.text: Thus saith theLord, The heavenismythrone, and the earthismy footstool: whereisthe house that ye build unto me? and whereisthe place of my rest?

2.text: For all thosethingshath mine hand made, and all thosethingshave been, saith theLord: but to thismanwill I look,eventohim that ispoor and of acontrite spirit, and trembleth at my word.

3.text: Hethat killeth an oxis as ifhe slew man; he that sacrificeth lamb,as ifhe cut off dogs neck; he that offereth an oblation,as if he offeredswines blood; he that burneth incense,as ifhe blessed an idol. Yea, they have chosen their own ways, and their soul delighteth in their abominations.

4.text: Ialso will choose their delusions, and will bring their fears upon them; because when Icalled, none did answer; when I spake, they did not hear: but they did evil before mine eyes, and chosethatin which I delighted not.

5.text: Hear the word of theLord, ye that tremble at his word; Your brethren that hated you, thatcastyou out for my names sake, said, Let theLordbeglorified: but he shall appear to your joy, and they shall be ashamed.

6.text: A voice of noise from the city, voice from the temple, voice of theLordthat rendereth recompence to his enemies.

7.text: Beforeshetravailed, she brought forth; before her pain came, she was delivered of manchild.

8.text: Who hath heard such thing? who hath seen such things? Shall the earth be made to bring forth in one day?orshall nation be born at once? for as soon as Zion travailed, she brought forth her children.

9.text: Shall I bring to the birth, and not cause to bring forth? saith theLord: shall I cause to bring forth, and shutthe womb?saith thy God.

10.text: Rejoice ye with Jerusalem, and be glad with her, all ye that love her: rejoice for joy with her, all ye that mourn for her:

11.text: That ye may suck, and be satisfied with the breasts of her consolations; that ye may milk out, and be delighted with the abundance of her glory.

12.text: For thus saith theLord, Behold, I will extend peace to herlike river, and the glory of theGentileslike flowing stream: then shall ye suck, ye shall be borne uponhersides, and be dandled uponherknees.

13.text: As one whom hismothercomforteth, so will Icomfortyou; and ye shall becomfortedin Jerusalem.

14.text: And when ye seethis,your heart shall rejoice, and your bones shall flourish like an herb: and thehandof theLordshall be known toward his servants, andhisindignationtoward his enemies.

15.text: For, behold, theLordwill come withfire, and with hischariotslike whirlwind, to render his anger with fury, and his rebuke with flames of fire.

16.text: For by fire and by hisswordwilltheLordpleadwith all flesh: and theslainof theLordshall be many.

17.text: They that sanctify themselves, and purify themselves in the gardens behind onetreein the midst, eating swines flesh, and theabomination, and themouse, shall be consumed together, saith theLord.

18.text: For Iknowtheirworksand their thoughts: it shall come, that I will gatherallnations and tongues; and they shall come, and see my glory.

19.text: And I will set asignamong them, and I will send those that escape of them unto the nations,toTarshish, Pul, andLud, that draw the bow,toTubal, and Javan,tothe isles afar off, that have not heard my fame, neither have seen my glory; and they shalldeclaremy glory among theGentiles.

20.text: And they shall bring all your brethrenforanofferingunto theLordout of all nations upon horses, and in chariots, and in litters, and upon mules, and upon swift beasts, to my holy mountain Jerusalem, saith theLord, as the children of Israel bring an offering in clean vessel into the house of theLord.

21.text: And I will also take of them forpriestsandfor Levites, saith theLord.

22.text: For as thenewheavens and the new earth, which I will make, shall remain before me, saith theLord, so shall yourseedand your name remain.

23.text: And it shall come to pass,thatfrom one new moon to another, and from one sabbath to another, shall all flesh come toworshipbefore me, saith theLord.

24.text: And they shall go forth, and look upon the carcases of the men that have transgressed against me: for theirwormshall not die, neither shall theirfirebe quenched; and they shall be an abhorring unto all flesh.
